name: Let It Train (Early Access)
description:
Check out the community area to keep up-to-date and what's happening - updates, polls, and more!

Note: There is currently no tutorial in-game. Follow the guide below, or try to figure out how to play by yourself for an extra challenge!

Patch notes & Upcoming updates

https://trello.com/b/keShr4cI/let-it-train-roadmap

How To Play

The train you bought to bring the water turned out to not be as stable as you thought it would be. So you're going to have to keep track of the different parts of it to make sure it's working in tip-top shape. There are 3 major components of the train that you will want to keep track of:

Speed
Warnings
The Radio

Speed
 Picture of the throttle

The green button speeds up the train, while the red button brings it down a notch.

Pay attention to the sounds your train makes and the speed of the tracks on the horizon to know when to speed up or slow down. Note that attempting to speed up or slow down when the train is in its ideal speed will result in the loss of water and no change being made to the speed.

Warnings

There are two types of warning systems installed on your train, the first one you will likely notice is the PAT-RN warning system, nobody has any idea what the system actually warns you of, but you should select the button that matches the one showing on the left-most display.

Picture of the PAT-RN warning system

The other warning system warns you about weight imbalances in the train, when you get an alert about an imbalance, click the dial on the same side as the imbalance.

Picture of the weight imbalance warning system The Radio

This one's the easiest to understand, when you go out of range of a radio tower you'll lose signal. Turn the dial next to the radio to regain connection.

Picture of the radio
